page.title: 07Clive Memorial Church House
page.content: The Clive Memorial Church House was built in 1911 to be used for functions to do with the Church such as the Harvest Festival Produce sale.The Womens Institute holds its monthly meeting there.Recently there was a bridge drive for Church funds.The hall can be hired out for functions such as receptions and parties. Upstairs the Sports and Social Club meet.Membership is Â£5 a year,which entitles the members to play any sport they like.These include snooker,pool, badminton, table tennis, tennis and bowls.The club has teams for snooker, pool,bowls and badminton.The bowling green and tennis courts were provided from funds left over from the Silver Jubilee celebrations and most of the work on these two projects was done by members of the club.
